#define N_FSM_NONE   (0xFFu)
#define N_FSM_ELSE   N_FSM_NONE
#define N_FSM_ANY_STATE   (0x7Fu)
#define N_FSM_STATE_BIT   (0x80u)
#define N_FSM_SAME_STATE   (0x7Fu)
#define N_FSM_OTHER_EVENT   (0x7Fu)
#define N_FSM_Transition_t   N_FSM_Transition_NoLog_t
#define N_FSM_StateMachine_t   N_FSM_StateMachine_NoLog_t
#define N_FSM_ENTRYEXIT(state, entry, exit)   {(uint8_t)(state), (entry), (exit)}
#define N_FSM_DECLARE(fsmVariable, transitionTable, transitionTableSize, entryExitTable, entryExitTableSize, actionFunction, checkFunction)
#define N_FSM_STATE(state)   { (N_FSM_STATE_BIT + (uint8_t)state), 0u, 0u, 0u }
#define N_FSM(event, condition, action, nextState)   { (uint8_t)(event), (uint8_t)(condition), (uint8_t)(action), (uint8_t)(nextState) }
#define N_FSM_TABLE_SIZE(ar)   ((uint8_t)(sizeof(ar)/sizeof(*(ar))))
#define N_FSM_INITIALIZE(pFsm, pActualState, initialState)   N_FSM_Initialize((pFsm), (pActualState), (uint8_t)(initialState))
#define N_FSM_PROCESS_EVENT(pFsm, pActualState, event)   N_FSM_ProcessEvent((pFsm), (pActualState), (uint8_t)(event) )

#define N_FSM_PROCESS_EVENT_2ARGS(pFsm, pActualState, event, arg1, arg2)   N_FSM_ProcessEvent2args((pFsm), (pActualState), (uint8_t)(event), (arg1), (arg2))

Definition in file N_Fsm.h.

Define Documentation

#define N_FSM_NONE   (0xFFu)

Placeholder to specify 'no condition' or 'no action'.

Definition at line 127 of file N_Fsm.h.

#define N_FSM_ELSE   N_FSM_NONE

Placeholder to specify 'else condition'.

Definition at line 130 of file N_Fsm.h.

#define N_FSM_ANY_STATE   (0x7Fu)

From-state placeholder to specify 'from any state'.

Definition at line 133 of file N_Fsm.h.

#define N_FSM_STATE_BIT   (0x80u)

Internally used in the N_FSM_STATE macro. Not to be used directly.

Definition at line 136 of file N_Fsm.h.

#define N_FSM_SAME_STATE   (0x7Fu)

To-state placeholder to specify 'no state transition -> no enter/exit actions'.

Definition at line 139 of file N_Fsm.h.

#define N_FSM_OTHER_EVENT   (0x7Fu)

Event placeholder to specify a default case ('all other events').

Definition at line 142 of file N_Fsm.h.

#define N_FSM_DECLARE (   fsmVariable,
  transitionTable,
  transitionTableSize,
  entryExitTable,
  entryExitTableSize,
  actionFunction,
  checkFunction 
)
Value:
static const N_FSM_StateMachine_t fsmVariable = \
    { \
        transitionTable, \
        transitionTableSize, \
        entryExitTable, \
        entryExitTableSize, \
        actionFunction, \
        checkFunction \
    }

Definition at line 59 of file N_Fsm.h.

typedef bool(* N_FSM_ConditionFunc_t)(N_FSM_Condition_t condition, int32_t arg1, int32_t arg2)

Type of condition function that determines whether a state transition should occur.

Parameters:
conditionThe condition to check
arg1The first argument
arg2The second argument
Returns:
Decides whether the transition is taken (TRUE) or not (FALSE)

Definition at line 79 of file N_Fsm.h.

typedef void(* N_FSM_ActionFunc_t)(N_FSM_Action_t action, int32_t arg1, int32_t arg2)

Type of action function to be called when a corresponding state transition occurs.

Parameters:
actionThe action to execute
arg1The first argument
arg2The second argument

Definition at line 86 of file N_Fsm.h.

typedef struct N_FSM_StateMachine_NoLog_t N_FSM_StateMachine_NoLog_t

Groups the tables and functions defining the finite state machine.

Function Documentation

void N_FSM_Initialize ( N_FSM_StateMachine_t const *  pFsm,
N_FSM_State_t *  pActualState,
N_FSM_State_t  initialState 
)

Initialize an N_FSM.

Parameters:
pFsmA pointer to a N_FSM_Fsm_t structure
pActualStatePointer to a parameter storing the actual state
initialStateThe initial state
Note:
Not intended for direct use. Use N_FSM_INITIALIZE() macro instead.
bool N_FSM_ProcessEvent ( N_FSM_StateMachine_t const *  pFsm,
N_FSM_State_t *  pActualState,
N_FSM_Event_t  event 
)

Processes the event through the N_FSM.

Parameters:
pFsmThe state machine to use
pActualStatePointer to a parameter storing the actual state
eventThe event to handle
Returns:
TRUE when the the event was handled, or FALSE when it was ignored
Note:
The condition function and action function are called with arg1 and arg2 set to 0
Not intended for direct use. Use N_FSM_PROCESS_EVENT() macro instead.
bool N_FSM_ProcessEvent1arg ( N_FSM_StateMachine_t const *  pFsm,
N_FSM_State_t *  pActualState,
N_FSM_Event_t  event,
int32_t  arg1 
)

Process the event through the N_FSM and pass 1 parameter to the condition and action functions.

Parameters:
pFsmThe state machine to use
pActualStatePointer to a parameter storing the actual state
eventThe event to handle
arg1The argument to pass to the condition and action functions
Returns:
TRUE when the the event was handled, or FALSE when it was ignored
Note:
The condition function and action function are called with arg2 set to 0
Not intended for direct use. Use N_FSM_PROCESS_EVENT_1ARG() macro instead.
bool N_FSM_ProcessEvent2args ( N_FSM_StateMachine_t const *  pFsm,
N_FSM_State_t *  pActualState,
N_FSM_Event_t  event,
int32_t  arg1,
int32_t  arg2 
)

Process the event through the N_FSM and pass 2 parameters to the condition and action functions.

Parameters:
pFsmThe state machine to use
pActualStatePointer to a parameter storing the actual state
eventThe event to handle
arg1The first argument to pass to the condition and action functions
arg2The second argument to pass to the condition and action functions
Returns:
TRUE when the the event was handled, or FALSE when it was ignored
Note:
Not intended for direct use. Use N_FSM_PROCESS_EVENT_2ARGS() macro instead.
